title: Managing Complex Forms with Controlled & Uncontrolled Inputs
content:
Definition:
Controlled inputs are managed by React state. Uncontrolled inputs rely on DOM refs.

Use:
Controlled forms allow validation, dynamic UI, and controlled submission. Uncontrolled forms are better for simple data entry.

Importance:
Forms are essential for authentication, checkout, settings, dashboards, etc.

Major Use & Advantages:
Controlled = More control
Uncontrolled = Better performance for large forms
syntax:
const [value, setValue] = useState("");
<input value={value} onChange={(e) => setValue(e.target.value)} />
examples: Uncontrolled: simple contact form with refs
Hybrid: controlled key fields, uncontrolled others
